alert.note: Alert for Greene; Knox; Sullivan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 26 at 8:41AM EDT until July 27 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Indiana, including the following counties, Daviess, Greene, Knox and Sullivan. * WHEN...Until noon EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 841 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vincennes, Washington, Bicknell, Odon, Elnora, Oaktown, Monroe City, Wheatland, Bruceville, Plainville, Sandborn, Montgomery, Edwardsport, Decker, Cannelburg, Alfordsville, Freelandville, Vincennes University, Glendale Fishery and West Boggs Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
